security: Disclosing that THOMPSON provided information about Captain HARVEY to the Soviets would reveal specific intelligence compromises and the potential betrayal of a U.S. Army officer to a foreign power. Quoting directly, “THOMPSON stated that he furnished whatever available information he had about HARVEY to the Soviets.” This could have severe repercussions for national security and international relations.
summary: An FBI report details information obtained from Robert Glenn Thompson regarding William K. Harvey, specifically that Thompson provided information about Harvey to the Soviets.
summary_one_paragraph: This FBI report, dated October 8, 1965, from the New York office to FBI Headquarters, summarizes information obtained from Robert Glenn Thompson (also known as Samuel Katzman, James Olson, Bob Robertson, and Tommy) regarding William K. Harvey. The report clarifies Thompson's story from a 'Saturday Evening Post' article and notes that Thompson identified Harvey as a Captain whose name appeared on communications from the 7983rd Army Unit to OSI Berlin. Thompson admitted to providing available information about Harvey to the Soviets, although he couldn't recall the specifics.
